page.title: 05Upper Chancton Farm
page.content: Upper Chancton Farm comprises approx. 410 acres and is given over mainly to arable production ( wheat and barley) with grass grazing for a herd of 106 beef cattle. The farm has been run for the past two years solely by{Mr John Eeles}and his two sons{Stephen}and{David.}The farmhouse, now divided into two for {Stephen}and{David's}families, dates back to 1721.{John}and his wife live close-by in a converted barn. The busiest time of the year is between July and October when harvesting and sowing for the following year takes place. As well as the beef cattle there are 5 horses, 20 'free range' chickens and 7 dogs. The beef cattle provide a major source of income with new stock being bought in from markets at Hereford,Guildford and Haywards Heath.
